current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to
		  require that genetically engineered food and foods that contain genetically
		  engineered ingredients be labeled accordingly.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and
			 Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which
			 was read twice and referred to the

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

The
			 purpose of this Act is to establish a consistent and enforceable standard for
			 labeling of foods produced using genetic engineering, including fish, thereby
			 providing consumers with knowledge of how their food is produced.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: requires the labeling of more than 3,000 ingredients, additives, and processes;

text.#text: the

individuals in
			 the United States have a right to know if their food was produced with genetic
			 engineering for a variety of reasons, including health, economic,
			 environmental, religious, and ethical;

more than 60
			 countries, including the United Kingdom and all other countries of the European
			 Union, South Korea, Japan, Brazil, Australia, India, China, and other key
			 United States trading partners have laws or regulations mandating disclosure of
			 genetically engineered food on food labels;

in 2011, Codex
			 Alimentarius, the food standards organization of the United Nations, adopted a
			 text that indicates that governments can decide on whether and how to label
			 foods produced with genetic engineering; and

mandatory
			 identification of food produced with genetic engineering can be a critical
			 method of preserving the economic value of exports or domestically sensitive
			 markets with labeling requirements for genetically engineered foods.

header.#text:
Amendments to
			 the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 403 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:403

text.#text: If it is a food that has been genetically engineered or contains 1 or more genetically engineered ingredients, unless such information is clearly disclosed, as determined by the

This paragraph does not apply to food
				that—

is served in restaurants or other
				similar eating establishments, such as cafeterias and carryouts;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 5(b) of the Orphan Drug Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Orphan Drug Act/s:5/ss:b

text.#text: is a medical food (as defined in

is a food that would be subject to
				this paragraph solely because it was produced using a genetically engineered
				vaccine; or

is a food or processed food that would
				be subject to this paragraph solely because it includes the use of a
				genetically engineered processing aid (including yeast) or enzyme.
In this paragraph:

term.#tail: means a process involving the application of—

text.#text: The term

in vitro nucleic acid techniques,
				including recombinant deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) and direct injection of
				nucleic acid into cells or organelles; or

fusion of cells beyond the
				taxonomic family that—

overcome natural physiological
				reproductive or recombinant barriers; and

are not techniques used in traditional
				breeding and selection.

term.#tail:
, used with respect to a food, means a material intended for
				human consumption that is—

text.#text: The term

an organism that is produced
				through the intentional use of genetic engineering; or

the progeny of intended sexual or
				asexual reproduction (or both) of 1 or more organisms that is the product of
				genetic engineering.

term.#tail:
means a material that is an ingredient in a food that is
				derived from any part of an organism that has been genetically engineered,
				without regard to whether—

text.#text: The term

the altered molecular or cellular
				characteristics of the organism are detectable in the material; and

the organism is capable for use as
				human
				food.

contains a statement to the effect

text.#text: No person shall be subject to the penalties of

such person is an agricultural
				producer and the violation occurs because food that is grown, raised, or
				otherwise produced by such producer, which food does not contain a genetically
				engineered material and was not produced with a genetically engineered
				material, is contaminated with a food that contains a genetically engineered
				material or was produced with a genetically engineered material; and

such contamination is not intended
				by the agricultural producer.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: does not apply to an agricultural producer to the extent that the contamination occurs as a result of the negligence of the producer.
